sunday.title: Stellar Astrophysics
sunday.content: A comprehensive study of the physical properties and life cycles of stars. This covers the process of star formation in molecular clouds, the mechanics of nuclear fusion (proton-proton chain and CNO cycle), and the eventual transition of stars into remnants such as white dwarfs, neutron stars, or black holes.

sunday.title: Geometry Foundations
sunday.content: An exploration of Euclidean geometry and its practical applications. The curriculum spans the basic elements of points, lines, and planes, the properties of 2D polygons and 3D solids, and the integration of algebra through coordinate geometry and the Cartesian plane.
